nzULt_osUt9KDKuFgsHnyQ.text: We loved this place for their pre-show dinner!  Great fresh food. Reasonable price. We stumbled across this restaurant near Leiscter square.

4dNNLg_cFVdECcET_m0jBQ.text: I had a meal there this week after seeing a film in town and I was suitably impressed. The restaurant was quiet and not too busy, I did put this down to the weather given how rainy it had been that day but nonetheless it lead to a very nice, relaxed meal as we had a whole table to ourselves. The food was more than satisfying and I had a pad thai which had prawns and crabmeat on top which was a new one for me. It was beautifully presented and they were very generous with the ratio of prawns and crab. Perhaps I had a generous chef or the accountant that controls portion sizes was having a night off. Nevertheless I was happy. My partner had some swordfish and coconut rice, we also had a bowl of morning glory which came with dried shrimp. It was very similar to many dishes of greens I have eaten when in southeast Asia and I really liked that everything we ate didn't taste as if it had been overly westernized. Food from this part of the world is meant to be tangy, salty, sometimes smelly, punchy and full of flavour that really packs a punch. Busaba succeeded well on this count. I also found myself newly in love with their lemongrass tea - not only does it taste good but it was presented wonderfully and they even brought honey to add if you wanted to sweeten it. The element of ceremony with the tea pot and cup made it a rather lovely affair. I found that the meal we had was very reasonably priced and presentation was good. We were fortunate enough to be there when it wasn't too busy so we didn't experience any table turning. The waitress was trying to up sell stuff a little but then that is par for the course if in a restaurant. I will return and would be interested to see what its like when it is busy.

fYGgJIbf5IpRXK-N9Jg5KA.text: I went here as hoping for a decent but fast pre-theatre meal. What I got was something that was very average, both in food and service. The food was unexciting. The sides felt pre-bought - I don't trust those spring rolls which all look uniformly the same size and shape as though turned out from a machine. The mains were acceptable but nothing special - under-spiced and nothing outstanding. At £8+ for a dish you would hope that would be better. On top of that, the service was slow. It took about 20 minutes from ordering to drinks arriving (although we were offered the wrong drinks after just five minutes). Everyone was very nice but, again, nothing special. It felt like the old Busaba experience had been diluted to become a chain-brand in much the same way as any of the other pan-Asian chains (Wagama, Miso, etc). What a shame. (As a final observation, the toilet signs are very odd: two pictures that don't appear to relate to either gender which means that there are constantly confused patrons hanging about outside requiring staff to keep coming over to explain. As far as I can make out the "" shaped one is men and the "Z" one is women...")

GqcCtzHoEuh6Xalca-FOqw.text: Checked out this location of Busaba yesterday while on a trip through London, Food and ambience was up to snuff and what you would hope and expect from a thai restaurant with the reputation that this place seems to have (and with lines out the door). Standard thai dishes with plenty of vegetarian options made it easy to find something. The food wasnt greasy as it sometimes can be but also didnt stand out as being totally amazing. For this price category just about what you would expect. What really takes away stars from this place, and maybe its just this location was that everything took forever once we had received a seat. Service was amazingly slow when it came time to pay (it took around 25 minutes from the time we asked for the bill until we left) and it also took a good 45 minutes for the food to come to our table after we had ordered it. Our waitress was also quite short and seemed quite rushed and frustrated the whole night. Conclusion- it could have been an off night but in terms of the wait staff but for standard thai food, Ill probably try somewhere else next time Im in town.

oPjX3dAFfiW_Q7aE_17fmA.text: we stopped in and had only a 5 minute wait for the table. it was noisy and busy but that was no surprise. we ordered and drinks arrived fast; food took a bit longer. I had green curry fried rice and my mom had pad Thai, plus we shared a veggie dish. all 3 were good and generous portions. my rice had some real kick to it, the veggies (greenbeans, broccoli, zucchini, cashews, pine nuts) were fresh & delicious, and my mom's pad Thai was satisfying. all that + 1 small wine was £26. we were happy and full, and that was good enough.

9O3vunaaj751uXD0OrvYCw.text: decent atmosphere and location, went quite late on a friday night and must have got the dregs of the curry - not much monkfish in one and not much lamb in the other. food itself tasted awesome though however was not impressed with the protein content!

92cEpleYNjAiq-AATAiMEg.text: Awesome food, great prices and great atmosphere! Came in hungry and left quite satisfied! Wait staff on the ball and quick to cleanup. Wish I could find this place in the U.S.!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

250BYsUR5UHfVpN9jVJFVw.text: You generally come away from Busaba satisfied and happy, and this branch is no different.Standard layout of multiple square tables inside that encourage chatting and sharing among groups of people, good quality, tasty food and happy service.This branch is quite big but can get busy purely due to the location, but you can do a lot worse than to come here to satisfy your hunger. I prefer it to Thai Square.

2NBMmDqts5zO5oXLEZ0ebQ.text: It's a great place for friends and family to get together on this big tables with a great vibe and awesome authentic Thai food. Service is prompt and the food delicious

bHYb1XZH5vP7yzUkYUpYDw.text: Busaba Eathai is a chain, so while their food is predictable and good value for money, it's still not going to have that extra magic to merit 5 stars. This occasion that I went, the crab fried rice was a bit too salty unfortunately, but everything else that we ordered (particularly the fried chicken!) was enjoyable.What I did want to highlight was the very good customer service we received. In the middle of eating our chilli prawn fried rice, we discovered a hair. We alerted the waitress. She took it back, and the manager came over to us to profusely apologise. He then offered to take the dish off our bill, and to also let us have another one of the same dish or sub in something else for free. He also took 25% off the rest of our bill. I was very impressed by this gesture as it really demonstrated the manager's desire to make things right, and we happily continued with the rest of our evening.How restaurants handle these situations speak a lot to their bearings. I will still come back!

1YdXsdToKA4FRJJAao_5tw.text: The first thing you notice about these restaurants is the amazing decor and the genuine atmosphere that comes along with it. The big tables are kind of strange but in a cool way, if your party is small you end up sitting sort of with other people which makes for a different experience. The food as well is absolutely lovely, though I do remember waiting a little while to get it and there being confusion about what was for starter and what was for main. I didn't order much on the day because I was wearing a very tight dress and wanted to maintain my composure (how shallow I was two years ago!) , but I tasted a little of everything my friends had and was dead jealous and impressed. Always a trusted option.

pYNIl3Oo40HcR2iiMi3VIA.text: My mother and I came here for lunch and absolutely loved it. We ordered a Phad Phak and Pandan Chicken for starters and we greatly enjoyed both. The Phad Phak had an amazing flavor to it, as well as the sauce for the Pandan Chicken. The best Thai starters I've ever had. I later ordered Mussaman duck curry with coconut rice and it was delicious. The coconut rice had the right amount of flavor and the duck had an excellent taste and texture. My mother ordered Char-grilled Salmon with coconut rice which was also really well made and with a lot of flavor. Service was also very good, the pleasant waiter was attentive and gave us good suggestions on what to order. I would happily come back and recommend the restaurant to anyone.

D4DzeBDofjFpOkGup4FANA.text: This is one of my favorite go-to places in London.  The food is very tasty and affordable.  Their Pandan chicken and Calamari are my usual orders but I've tried almost all of the dishes on their menu and I was satisfied with every one of them.  The ambiance is trendy and cool.  You share a table with others so if you are looking for someplace quiet and intimate to take your special someone to...then you might want to look somewhere else but if they don't mind sitting with a bunch of strangers then go ahead and enjoy their fabulous food.

0LcRIwvJCRKbAyFtKQIjMg.text: Busaba EathaiI've always liked this place- sure, it's a little overpriced and a little clattery, but the food is decent enough, if it's not the greatest place.It gets the bump up due to excellent service-- or an excellent recovery. Got in, seated promptly and then sat about 5 minutes. The maiitre'dnoticed I hadn't been served and got right on it- then brought me one of their super-expensive & nice house-made juices on the house- I didn't ask. An apology would have been enough, but it was most appreciated.So there you go. Four stars. Thanks, Busaba.

IXBPw-JtrTTqKx5Vfwh3LQ.text: When my friends, who know I am a fan of Thai cuisine, heard that I hadn't yet been to Busaba, looked at me aghast. I'd since resolved that I'd eat at the establishment at the first opportunity available. And such an occasion arrived soon enough when a friend was in town and made plans to meet his friends over dinner. And he said, we're meeting at Busaba at Piccadilly Circus. And I trotted on my high heels right over to the establishment across from Princi. And waited for a solid 20mins before I realised with no small degree of exasperation that there was indeed a new Busaba outlet closer to Piccadilly Circus than I had realised and I went over with a rumbling tummy and feet that were starting to complain.I started with the relaxing ginger and honey tea served with a cashew and coconut cookie. I perused the pages of delicious sounding food, and for some unfathomable reason, I played safer than my usual adventurous self, and went for a rather staid Ginger Beef with Thai pepper, chilli and spring onion, with a side of Phad Phak with French bean, broccoli, courgette, baby corn, cashew and pine nut and Coconut rice. Food was tasty all round, and I was pleased with the preparations but I was not impressed with their somewhat mean serving size - of course, it could also be that I was ravenously hungry from standing around outside restaurants and trudging on my heels. The service was nothing to write home about but not too bad either. My vegetarian friend (I seem to have one with me in every Yelp review!) seemed happy with the selection on offer.So ok, I will admit that I am probably being less kind to this establishment than I might have otherwise been. Also, on that evening, as I was meeting a bunch of new people, I couldn't appreciate the shared seating arrangement on benches and the loud ambiance of the restaurant. I'll just have to go back sometime to check for consistency, I guess!

nXvSkKxWNjE4BjHj260kAg.text: A couple of my friends are always banging on about how amazing Busaba is and I just thought they were being over the top but then when the three of us and another friend went there a few months ago, I was pleasantly surprised. I found it difficult to choose from the menu as there were so many things I liked the sound of, so my friend and I decided to share - from memory we had coconut rice; a side of vegetables with cashew nuts which were amazing; pumpkin curry and I think duck. The bottle or two *ahem* of red wine that we all shared was lovely too, the service was great, just a tad annoying with the communal seating as we were joined by other customers when we were halfway through our meal. Located well, close to Leicester Square, Piccadilly Circus and Haymarket it is as Central as you could hope. Can't wait to return! I'm salivating now.... :-s

t2vKJli_mgP1VMdq4aqQnw.text: Spacious restaurant, lots of sitting by the windows, with cheerful staff and good food. Prices are reasonable.

9vfnUcCzElLc31HpwqC91w.text: I like Busaba Eathai and that is why I like this Busaba Eathai because it's Busaba Eathai and I always like it.

Wnx-SfSPEPWl58y5NLGbxQ.text: Eat there today, it's a average Thai restaurant, which means I enjoyed my meal.  The menu is select, and many of the dishes that I enjoy are not on the menu, specifically larb.  Mixed experience on the food, the fish curry was excellent, the Pad Kwiteow Gai was good, and the Pad King Talay was just faire.  The service was prompt and courteous and the décor was very nice.  I recommend it, but I'm pretty sure there are better Thai restaurants in London.

jiS5LC68qiqTA2Zy5Vv1Dg.text: I've been here a couple of times now and it's just so good  no queue as with the Wardour Street branch, the staff are really cheerful and efficient, and there's something incredibly decadent about a doorman who doesn't behave like someone who's judging you.I love the incense and candles as you come in, and the whole spacious decor of the place makes me feel instantly like I'm on holiday.Last night I had the excellent chicken satay again (great chicken with a little yoghurt, and lovely satay) and the Koh Samui juice (coconut, orange and carrot) which was quite spectacular. My Tom Kha chicken soup required playing that annoying game Is it chicken, or is it lemongrass? but tasted lovely.A fantastic place to eat around Leicester Square and Piccadilly Circus, which isn't exactly troubled for same.

tkLfmjqBUZxORtc338IDWA.text: Barely edible food. The two stars are because the decor is very pleasant and I'd probably enjoy coming here for a drink and chilling. Husband and I came here for lunch on a Saturday. I knew it was bad news bears when he asked for jungle curry with beef - the menu has jungle curry with chicken and red curry with beef. The fact that they cannot substitute meats means that the dishes are probably frozen and pre-packaged, not freshly prepared. So he went for red curry beef and I went for "Chiang Mai noodle soup," their interpretation of the Chiang Mai classic khao soi. Food arrived. Beef curry was tough and practically inedible. Noodles were OK but I could get better from an instant noodle pot. Also, it took over 20 minutes to flag down a server to get the check - and the place was NOT busy - there were only three or four other tables eating. I get that the bar for Thai food in London is very low, but Busaba still disappointed me.

un26YizRCvR6qTvuDmLpAg.text: I was surprised to find good Thai food at a decent price so close to Leicester Square.  The atmosphere was really cool and swank.  I wouldn't say totally authentic, but in a touristy area, it was a great change of pace.

n_Br3bEquabJfUDo1a2cyQ.text: I love Busaba! The calamari is always a winner for me and my friends and it's one dish no one ever wants to share. I have been to most of the Busaba's in London and it can get quite busy and loud in most. The sharing tables are fine, but not good for people on first dates, please don't put yourself and others through that trauma! I have had to witness it. The service is always good and everyone too the door man are very friendly. I'm constantly getting my friends on the Busaba bandwagon, if you aren't on it yet, what's wrong with you?

e9A5oIsM2wNGHaJRsi6ujA.text: Centrally placed, reasonably priced place for fairly quick eats - food is workmanlike, and perhaps lacks a bit of oomph, but this place is perfect for a quick lunch or evening meal. Assuming you like Thai food of course.

0YoeD7FLZ3BzCBnVeyNatw.text: Just ok Thai 'like' food. I guess no one claimed its authentic. A PF Chang attempt at Thai. I guess many locals like it. I would not go back.

CvV0MnI76dxiPcAAEB7VUg.text: Food good as usual, nice decor and very central. 50% off good when you pay with their App during the month of January

9BXYC8LvTd7LXg_SmkkHTw.text: Got the green curry (vegan and creamy) with the Thai roti (greasy deliciousness- simply the best). Our table shared edamame (standard), and Chinese broccoli (excellent). I'm docking a point because it didn't blow me away but was definitely somewhere I would recommend.Place was clean in addition to the bathrooms. Nice place to relax for lunch as it wasn't too busy on a Saturday

s6_Q7dqTEXHjBvI68OY5vQ.text: Excellent food and location.  Stopped in for dinner before going to the theater at Prince of Wales, right around the corner.  Lovely restaurant with plenty of seating for large parties or even just an individual.  Service was great and came with a smile and recommendations.  Lots of veggie and vegan options.I had the green vegetarian curry and sweet potato fries-both EXCELLENT.  Paired with a nice red and made for a superb meal before the show.  I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

j_OmAOadRZmgr9WRy7gW6w.text: This place was recommended to us. Our first dinner in London. The area was great. It's close to all the shops and close to the underground metro. We we're seated right away. The portions are really small. It's good for one person that's not really hungry. Their sweet and sour chicken had only four chickens and the rest are vegetables. The pad thai was mostly bean sprouts not enough noodles. The appetizer came when we were done eating the main course. And the waitress never came back to refill the water. I've tasted better Thai food at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

JE9MKcpxeRt4m2IxwUx2vw.text: Very average food , dumped on your table unceremoniously - the wait staff seem to have limited English (odd in a central London restaurant ) and don't really care about the customer experience : I ordered a bottled beer with my meal; when it never arrived and I mentioned this to my waiter he explained that the barman is new .  And so it went - bad to worse.  And very average food.

KcwZSopGA5WD5dFDTVutUg.text: This my second time in London and my second time to Busaba. The food is very clean tasting and refreshing bursts of flavor. Although I enjoy Thai food, I will never say I'm a  connoisseur of real traditional taste. I can say that Busaba hasn't disappointed myself or my coworkers yet. Enjoy....

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. Coconut & Pineapple Busaba Blend was very light, but nice flavors
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. I have a terrible memory. This was a chicken, curry with coconut and noodles. It was rich and creamy sauce with a nice balance of flavor.
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. Avocado and Hot Thai Mint Super Salad, has some crisp flavors and a bit of heat once in a while. Over hit the spot on a hot evening.

NF9n0LCu_I_yUNIKAWQ8rQ.text: Chose two of the set menu options with snack, small plate and meal; each for £19.99. We had the chips/seaweed for the snack and satay skewers/bang-kick prawns for the small plates. For our meals we had Tamarind duck breast char-grill and the Thai seafood pasta. The duck was the chewiest meat I've had in my entire life. Don't ever say that's the way duck is. Go to a Chinese restaurant and try duck (When done right it does not require excessive chewing). The flavor was good. The cooking and preparation of the duck was not. 0/5The pasta was spicy, but it featured the tiniest mussels I've ever seen in my entire life. The shrimp was small as well. Here's some advice, quality over quantity. Dropped the mussels and put in bigger shrimp or the other way around. There's no point in having more with less quality. The flavor of the pasta was a bit lacking. It had a kick to it. It was ordered with the yam fries. That's impossible to screw up, ... just kidding. The dip was a Siracha Mayo mix and it was way too much Siracha and not enough Mayo. It lacked creaminess. There's a Siracha bottle on every table. If I wanted more Siracha I could and it. I didn't need it to be 90% Siracha and 10% Mayo. 3/5The snacks were OK. Like literally OK. 3/5The small plates were not terrible. Shrimp were tiny but that's ok for an appetizer dish that was more based on flavor. Flavor wasn't excellent. Chicken satay skewers would be dry had it not been the sauce. 2/5We had 2 mango Lassi, too much yogurt, not enough mango, and needed more ice. Overall, well you can guess. When it comes to proportion, maybe it's a preference but... 2.5/5The service, when it shows up, they're decent. But we found we were forgotten. They already tack on service charge. So adding any more is all up to you. I believe if they know you exist that they should be rewarded, IF they did.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

yQm-laIYjBdDMrCmmm936g.text: This was the best Thai food I've had in years. Mind you, our only reference point for good Thai is the crud you get in the US. The flavors here were amazing and very delicious. We went back here twice over our 5 day stay and believe me there are a million places I love in London. Can't wait to visit again just to sample their menu!

EREm9NLxOH9aKBdaIAhN1g.text: I had a minor cold so I wanted some soup. I ordered the chicken soup. It was skimpy on the noodles and I had to eat another meal three hours later.

lwLzYXKZOZfDnVjNG5iLSg.text: I had the black pepper beef noodles, Thai calamari, snake bean salad and spring rolls. They were all  very good. Never seen these dishes in the States. I like how the restaurant sit people in large commune tables of 10 people different concept.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

xG7E20jucdtZ-ikfAXkl9g.text: Not a bad stop near the theaters. The space is huge, plenty of seating. They had a combo meal for early dinner which is what I got. I had the spring rolls and the beef stir fry. It was pretty good and wasn't too expensive, around £12 for the combo. It was a nice change from typical British fare.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

ZlxxTYutSBIhaLS1Xzg82A.text: This restaurant is a little bit weird. All the tables seem to be made for groups of 9 or more, so if you come alone or with another person you will most likely be seated with strangers at the same large table. The service is not great. It takes a long time to get menus, to get drinks, or even to put in an order. The good news is, that once you do put in an order, the food shows up quickly. Since it's been a while since I ate here, I don't have many comments about the food. The fish cake was decent, and the King Prawns I had were cooked well. The sauce was tasty too but I remember my mouth being really unhappy with the level of spiciness in the dishes.Bottom line is, this is a decent place to eat, but don't expect any service whatsoever.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. Bangkok King Prawn
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. Spring rolls
Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom. Fish Cakes

szfzM5RcfqyGtrPohLrXSQ.text: Spaghetti is not Thai pan fried noodles. The service was mediocre and horrible food. Would never visit again or recommend to anyone. The ambiance and decor was the only decent part of the restaurant.

T6Qp4jjA51qzccNLtKUj7A.text: The food is good. The menu is slightly different from other Thai offers. Noodles and Theatre combos are worth to try. Be prepared for big tables. Gets crowed and service could improve.

IKouCpvunyPlTKY6ltIkTQ.text: Absolutely delicious. The chicken satay was the most tender I've ever had. The food is much less spicy than I anticipated for Thai, but that seems to be the norm for England. The quality was superb and I'd happily dine here again. One small complaint, the seats are all benches. This can be a little uncomfortable if you have a a bad back, but won't be an issue for most patrons.

xeJazw-ntNZloDKwvpRDBA.text: I really liked the food here, I was looking for a place not far from where our University Center was and this place seemed to fit the bill, but what I could not get over was how hot it was in this establishment. The tables are all family style and you wind up with sitting with strangers, which is sort of fun in itself, so as long as you don't mind rubbing elbows, dive in here!The food; was delicious-as I said, the duck curry was amazing with coconut rice that was very fluffy. My friends got a starter of these shrimp chips, that were salty and definitely helped us as we waited for our food. The service was very good I thought, but this was a rainy day and I guess I just expected it to be a little better temperature inside than out. If you're looking for a place to go for more...upscale thai? This might be your new go to.

771PtOh0zatJOycpRh7uyA.text: Recently visited Busaba for a pre movie dinner to discover they do an excellent pre theatre set menu.  Two courses for £9.90I've always loved the food here, and with the pre theatre set menu it has become a really great value for money, tasty option for a quick feed. We had the spring rolls and the Thai calamari. The calamari is an absolute favourite of mine, I always order it.For mains we had the ginger beef and the pad Thai. Both were delicious and filling portions. Good selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks to select from.Service was great and very efficient. Highly recommend for a quick pre theatre dinner, or a regular dinner night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

QCpS0cZ_zAuPaC2MOwa8ZA.text: It was a Friday night and the restaurants are full and I remember walking in the regent street with my wife and kid hungry and desperately calling every restaurant near of our hotel " Cafe Royal " without finding one single table and I was really desperate until I saw this restaurant and said to myself " this is the final attempt and I'll eat in my room if I couldn't find anything ". I called them and answered by a nice lady telling me that it's ok to come and they will get us a table.The restaurant was amazing and the food is delicious. I ordered duck curry and coconut rice and absolutely love it. The taste really remind me of the good old days in my journey to phucket island, Thailand couple years ago. Same yummy thai food. Every things was great in this restaurant, the friendly staff , the food and the price. The ONLY thing bothered me is the noise. Really annoying and high

3PyWq6cHien5wT1p8VRsLw.text: flavour wise you can not and I repeat CAN NOT go wrong with busaba.. Their dishes are very tasty and the prices are pretty reasonable... I was here just yesterday refulling my body for the upcoming champagne indulgence I was about to revel in! They have great set menus which really hit the spots and not the pockets... For £12.90 I had a three set menu starting with prawn crackers accompanied with sweet chilli sauce.. Those crackers were the business! It was like biting into fresh prawns! They packed mad flavour in there let me tell you ...Next I had the sticky tamarind chicken wings which were packing flavour too! Hot damn it was revelation!Then I had a healthy plate of pad Thai noodles with smoked chicken and prawns... FLAVOUR CITY right there! So much flavour in there I found myself humming throughout my meal. Let's just say it was a great day thanks to this meal lolOnly downside was that I was sitting next to a greedy woman who insisted on stripping her wings down to the marrow! Jeeeez

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Leicester Square - London, United Kingdom

_kTYRcP3Cue4RdMEzLlbGw.text: Atmosphere was nice. Food was pretty good!  Had the British short ribs that were cooked perfect. Wife had beef salad that she said was great. Wait staff was almost non-existent. Drinks were very hard to come by even water.

OB0MW-wXCTjOYzabtJ4iqQ.text: Had an early dinner here tonight before the theatre. Placed a drink order with one waiter, then two minutes later another waiter arrived and asked if we'd like a drink. Okay, no biggie, that can happen. But it gets you wondering: who is our waiter, exactly? My Tanqueray and tonic arrives. I pour the bottle of tonic water into the gin in the glass, which has only  two measly - and nearly melted - ice cubes in it (I thought the Brits had finally figured out how to make ice?). I take a sip. Blech! Diet tonic water. I hate diet tonic water. I flag down a waiter and ask for a new drink with regular tonic. A few minutes later another waiter (manager, perhaps) comes by and apologizes: they do not have regular tonic water. Seriously?!? I switch to wine. We order our food - appetizers and mains. Waiter announces that all the food will come out at the same time. No choice in the matter apparently, and no explanation why the appetizers can't come out first. Food takes far longer than it should considering it is not that busy and it's just Pad Thai, chicken satay, and spring rolls. Food was okay, nothing great. All in all I'd give the service 1 star and the food 3, so I'll average it out to 2 stars overall. I will not go back. There are other places with average food that manage to get drinks right and serve starters before mains.
